segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine, and we're shoe shopping again.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，我们又要去买鞋了。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We are going shoe shopping, but this time it's a little bit more complicated because we're getting women's shoes.
segments.cn: 我们要去买鞋，但这次有点复杂，因为我们要买女鞋。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So there are so many different kinds of women's shoes.
segments.cn: 女鞋种类繁多。

segments.en: I'm not even sure I know them all myself, but in this intermediate level lesson, we're going to cover some of the basics for you.
segments.cn: 我甚至不确定我是否知道所有种类，但在这节中级课中，我们将为你介绍一些基础知识。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So before we jump into this dialogue, we have a word that we want to preview with you today, and let's take a look at it now on Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 在我们开始对话之前，我们有一个想要预览的单词，现在让我们在词汇预览中看看。

segments.en: Okay, so we're shopping today for a certain kind of shoe.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们要买一种特定的鞋。

segments.en: It's not a sports shoe.
segments.cn: 这不是运动鞋。

segments.en: It's a dress shoe.
segments.cn: 是正装鞋。

segments.en: Okay, that kind of doesn't make sense because a dress is a noun, a shoe is a noun, and so you want to get a shoe that's a dress?
segments.cn: 好吧，这有点不合理，因为“正装”是名词，“鞋”也是名词，所以你想要一双“正装”的鞋？

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 不。

segments.en: A dress shoe is a style of shoe.
segments.cn: 正装鞋是一种鞋的风格。

segments.en: It means shoes that you wear when you're wearing fancy clothes.
segments.cn: 意思是你穿着华丽衣服时所穿的鞋。

segments.en: So it's kind of like a formal shoe.
segments.cn: 所以这有点像正式鞋。

segments.en: A dress shoe is for a type of shoe that would go well with a dress.
segments.cn: 正装鞋是与裙子搭配的鞋。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Not sneakers.
segments.cn: 不是运动鞋。

segments.en: But don't be fooled.
segments.cn: 但不要被误导。

segments.en: This is not about dresses because men can wear dress shoes too.
segments.cn: 这与裙子无关，因为男性也可以穿正装鞋。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It means shoes you would wear to a conference or to a wedding or to church.
segments.cn: 这意味着你会穿去会议、婚礼或教堂的鞋。

segments.en: So these are things that are a little bit fancier than everyday shoes.
segments.cn: 所以这些鞋比日常鞋稍微华丽一些。

segments.en: Okay, awesome.
segments.cn: 好的，太棒了。

segments.en: So we're shopping for a dress shoe and there are so many types and styles of shoes for women, so why don't we listen to our dialogue for the first time and we'll be back in a second.
segments.cn: 所以我们在找正装鞋，女鞋有很多种类和风格，为什么我们不先听听对话，然后我们马上回来。

segments.en: Hi, excuse me, sir.
segments.cn: 嗨，打扰一下，先生。

segments.en: I'm looking for a dress shoe.
segments.cn: 我在找一双正装鞋。

segments.en: My usual pair that I've had for years have finally been stretched out of shape.
segments.cn: 我多年来穿的那双鞋终于变形了。

segments.en: They didn't provide any support anymore.
segments.cn: 它们已经不再提供支持了。

segments.en: Sure, what kind of shoe are you looking for?
segments.cn: 当然，你在找什么样的鞋？

segments.en: We've got strappy sandals, sleek high heels, edgy pumps.
segments.cn: 我们有带带凉鞋、时尚高跟鞋、前卫的泵鞋。

segments.en: If you're looking for something a little more practical, we've got Mary Janes, ballerinas.
segments.cn: 如果你在找更实用的东西，我们有玛丽珍鞋、芭蕾舞鞋。

segments.en: Show me some classic high heels, please.
segments.cn: 请给我看看一些经典的高跟鞋。

segments.en: Okay, right this way.
segments.cn: 好的，这边请。

segments.en: What color did you have in mind?
segments.cn: 你想要什么颜色？

segments.en: Black, classic.
segments.cn: 黑色，经典。

segments.en: Of course, we've got this style here that is very popular.
segments.cn: 当然，我们这里有一种非常受欢迎的款式。

segments.en: Because it's an open-toe shoe, you can wear it any time of the year.
segments.cn: 因为它是开放式鞋，你可以在任何季节穿。

segments.en: They look great on everyone.
segments.cn: 它们在每个人身上都很好看。

segments.en: Too shiny.
segments.cn: 太闪亮了。

segments.en: And I wear pantyhose with my shoes, so let's look for a closed-toe shoe.
segments.cn: 我穿丝袜，所以我们找一双封闭式鞋吧。

segments.en: Okay, these are a very nice pair of leather shoes with a two-inch heel, so they are very comfortable.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一双非常不错的皮鞋，带有两英寸的跟，非常舒适。

segments.en: I don't like the pointed toes.
segments.cn: 我不喜欢尖头鞋。

segments.en: Let me take a look at what else you have.
segments.cn: 让我看看你还有什么。

segments.en: Too high.
segments.cn: 太高了。

segments.en: That one looks like the back would cut into my heel.
segments.cn: 那双看起来后面会磨到我的脚跟。

segments.en: I have a high instep, so I doubt that one would fit properly.
segments.cn: 我有高脚背，所以我怀疑那双鞋合不合适。

segments.en: I don't want bows.
segments.cn: 我不想要蝴蝶结。

segments.en: I find slingbacks very uncomfortable.
segments.cn: 我觉得后跟鞋非常不舒服。

segments.en: Those might as well be stilettos.
segments.cn: 那些简直就像细高跟鞋。

segments.en: Too modern.
segments.cn: 太现代了。

segments.en: Ah, finally, this is what I'm looking for.
segments.cn: 啊，终于，这就是我想要的。

segments.en: What size?
segments.cn: 什么尺码？

segments.en: Seven and a half.
segments.cn: 七号半。

segments.en: Here we are.
segments.cn: 给你。

segments.en: How does it fit?
segments.cn: 穿着怎么样？

segments.en: Mmm, not good.
segments.cn: 嗯，不好。

segments.en: They're too tight.
segments.cn: 太紧了。

segments.en: The length is right, but the shoe is too narrow, and it's pinching my toes.
segments.cn: 长度合适，但鞋子太窄，夹到我的脚趾。

segments.en: And there'd be no room for my insoles.
segments.cn: 而且没有空间放我的鞋垫。

segments.en: Oh, you know what?
segments.cn: 哦，你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I have the Patience for this today.
segments.cn: 我今天没有耐心。

segments.en: They just don't make shoes like they used to.
segments.cn: 他们就是不再做像以前那样的鞋了。

segments.en: I'll come back another time.
segments.cn: 我改天再来。

segments.en: Have a nice day, ma'am.
segments.cn: 祝您有美好的一天，女士。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So a lot of shoe styles, as you noticed, a lot of them are very... I don't know, I don't even know what they are.
segments.cn: 所以很多鞋款，正如你所注意到的，很多我都不知道是什么。

segments.en: So why don't we try and explain them now on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以我们现在来解释一下它们吧，在语言收获中。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: So the first kind of shoe we've got here is very popular in the summer.
segments.cn: 所以我们这里的第一种鞋在夏天非常受欢迎。

segments.en: It's called a strappy sandal.
segments.cn: 它叫做带带凉鞋。

segments.en: A strappy sandal.
segments.cn: 带带凉鞋。

segments.en: So we know what a sandal is.
segments.cn: 我们知道凉鞋是什么。

segments.en: It's kind of like what you wear to the beach.
segments.cn: 就像你去海滩时穿的那种。

segments.en: It's a shoe that it doesn't really cover your whole foot, just the bottom.
segments.cn: 这是一种不完全覆盖整个脚的鞋，只覆盖底部。

segments.en: It's very open.
segments.cn: 它非常开放。

segments.en: And well, what about strappy?
segments.cn: 那么，带带呢？

segments.en: Strappy comes from the word strap.
segments.cn: 带带来自于“带”这个词。

segments.en: So a strap is like a thin piece of fabric or leather that connects other pieces.
segments.cn: 所以带是连接其他部分的薄布或皮革片。

segments.en: And so a strappy sandal means that it's got many of these different little straps on it, many lines everywhere that connect it.
segments.cn: 所以带带凉鞋意味着它有很多不同的小带子，四处连接。

segments.en: So it's very open.
segments.cn: 所以它非常开放。

segments.en: It's made of many different thin pieces.
segments.cn: 由许多不同的薄片组成。

segments.en: Okay, good.
segments.cn: 好的，好的。

segments.en: So we have a strappy sandal.
segments.cn: 所以我们有带带凉鞋。

segments.en: Basically a sandal with many straps.
segments.cn: 基本上是有很多带子的凉鞋。

segments.en: And well, she went on to describe a sleek high heel.
segments.cn: 她接着描述了一双时尚高跟鞋。

segments.en: So this is a two-part thing here.
segments.cn: 这是一个两部分的东西。

segments.en: Sleek is an adjective which basically means really cool looking.
segments.cn: 时尚是一个形容词，基本上意味着看起来很酷。

segments.en: Or more like it's pretty and fancy and usually sleek things are also kind of simple.
segments.cn: 或者更像是它漂亮、华丽，通常时尚的东西也比较简单。

segments.en: Like a Jaguar's very sleek car.
segments.cn: 就像一辆捷豹的非常时尚的车。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And so this is the adjective to describe the high heels.
segments.cn: 所以这是用来形容高跟鞋的形容词。

segments.en: So we have high heels.
segments.cn: 所以我们有高跟鞋。

segments.en: Okay, we have high heels that are kind of fancy shoe.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有高跟鞋，这是一种华丽的鞋。

segments.en: Basically these are shoes that are not flat.
segments.cn: 基本上这些鞋子不是平底的。

segments.en: So the heel is very tall.
segments.cn: 所以跟非常高。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So basically this is what a lot of women wear with dresses.
segments.cn: 基本上，这就是很多女性穿着裙子时的鞋子。

segments.en: Basically the heel has a piece that kind of sticks out and makes the woman look taller.
segments.cn: 基本上，鞋跟有一部分突出，使女性看起来更高。

segments.en: So basically it's like they're walking on the tips of their toes the entire time.
segments.cn: 所以基本上她们就像一直在用脚尖走路。

segments.en: Right, and they make click, cluck, click, cluck.
segments.cn: 对，发出咔嗒、咔嗒的声音。

segments.en: They make that sound.
segments.cn: 她们发出那种声音。

segments.en: But there are different kinds of heels.
segments.cn: 但鞋跟有不同种类。

segments.en: Okay, high heels obviously means that they're tall.
segments.cn: 好吧，高跟鞋显然是指高的。

segments.en: You can have low heels too.
segments.cn: 你也可以有低跟鞋。

segments.en: Those are shorter.
segments.cn: 那些更短。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: But high heels there are different kinds.
segments.cn: 但高跟鞋有不同种类。

segments.en: One kind is pumps.
segments.cn: 一种是泵鞋。

segments.en: Pumps, okay.
segments.cn: 泵鞋，好吧。

segments.en: In the dialogue we actually saw the salesman describe them as edgy pumps.
segments.cn: 在对话中，我们实际上看到销售员把它们描述为前卫泵鞋。

segments.en: So edgy, what does edgy mean?
segments.cn: 那么前卫，前卫是什么意思？

segments.en: Edgy means cool or hip.
segments.cn: 前卫意味着酷或时髦。

segments.en: So young people like to wear edgy clothes, like rock and roll kind of clothes.
segments.cn: 所以年轻人喜欢穿前卫的衣服，比如摇滚风格的衣服。

segments.en: Not so much older people.
segments.cn: 年长的人就不太喜欢。

segments.en: Okay, and pumps are a type of high heel you say, but what is the difference?
segments.cn: 好吧，泵鞋是一种高跟鞋，但有什么区别呢？

segments.en: Well, pumps basically are the kind of simple heel that a woman will wear with a pantsuit or with a skirt to the office.
segments.cn: 嗯，泵鞋基本上是女性穿着西装或裙子去办公室的简单鞋跟。

segments.en: And so they usually have a closed toe and they're quite simple heels.
segments.cn: 所以它们通常是封闭的鞋头，鞋跟相当简单。

segments.en: Okay, and the opposite or well maybe a little bit different from pumps would be stilettos.
segments.cn: 好吧，与泵鞋相对或稍微不同的是细高跟鞋。

segments.en: So stilettos are a very special kind of heel.
segments.cn: 所以细高跟鞋是一种非常特殊的鞋跟。

segments.en: Stiletto.
segments.cn: 细高跟。

segments.en: It refers basically to the difference in the back of the shoe where you have the heel.
segments.cn: 它基本上指的是鞋后跟的不同。

segments.en: Because sometimes heels are kind of thick and heavy and they make the clonk clonk sound.
segments.cn: 因为有时鞋跟比较厚重，会发出咣咣的声音。

segments.en: But stilettos are very very very thin and very very tall.
segments.cn: 但细高跟非常非常细，非常非常高。

segments.en: Okay, so stiletto heels.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以是细高跟鞋。

segments.en: I think it's probably easier to walk with pumps rather than stilettos, right?
segments.cn: 我觉得穿泵鞋比穿细高跟鞋更容易走路，对吧？

segments.en: Stilettos are famous for being very very hard to walk in.
segments.cn: 细高跟鞋以非常难走而闻名。

segments.en: It's almost like the back of your heel is a chopstick.
segments.cn: 几乎就像你的脚后跟是筷子。

segments.en: Wow, I cannot imagine doing that.
segments.cn: 哇，我无法想象这样做。

segments.en: Alright, so this is the classification of our high heels.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们高跟鞋的分类。

segments.en: Why don't we move on now to Mary Janes.
segments.cn: 我们现在为什么不继续谈谈玛丽珍鞋。

segments.en: Okay, so we've got high heels and heels.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有高跟鞋和鞋跟。

segments.en: We also have flats.
segments.cn: 我们还有平底鞋。

segments.en: These are flat shoes.
segments.cn: 这些是平底鞋。

segments.en: So one important kind of flats is a Mary Jane.
segments.cn: 所以一种重要的平底鞋是玛丽珍鞋。

segments.en: Sounds like a name.
segments.cn: 听起来像个名字。

segments.en: Yeah, it is a name, right?
segments.cn: 是的，这确实是个名字，对吧？

segments.en: Mary Jane.
segments.cn: 玛丽珍。

segments.en: So what type of shoe is this?
segments.cn: 那么这是什么类型的鞋？

segments.en: This is basically a... usually a leather shoe, but it can be different materials.
segments.cn: 这基本上是... 通常是皮鞋，但可以是不同的材料。

segments.en: And it's round in the front and it has one strap and they're very cute.
segments.cn: 它前面是圆的，有一条带子，非常可爱。

segments.en: Usually little girls wear Mary Janes, but they're pretty popular these days with older people too.
segments.cn: 通常小女孩穿玛丽珍鞋，但现在年长的人也很喜欢。

segments.en: Okay, so they're round in the front.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以它们前面是圆的。

segments.en: They are usually black.
segments.cn: 通常是黑色的。

segments.en: And they have one little strap that goes over the top of your foot.
segments.cn: 并且有一条小带子在脚背上。

segments.en: Mary Janes.
segments.cn: 玛丽珍鞋。

segments.en: Alright, so we've taken a look at Mary Janes now.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们现在看过玛丽珍鞋了。

segments.en: Moving on to, I think it's a similar type of shoe, ballerina shoes.
segments.cn: 接下来，我认为是类似类型的鞋，芭蕾舞鞋。

segments.en: Well, ballerina shoes are similar because they're flat.
segments.cn: 嗯，芭蕾舞鞋相似，因为它们是平底的。

segments.en: But that's about it.
segments.cn: 但就这些。

segments.en: Ballerina shoes are very very thin.
segments.cn: 芭蕾舞鞋非常非常薄。

segments.en: They're very very weak.
segments.cn: 它们非常非常脆弱。

segments.en: And usually they're pretty simple.
segments.cn: 通常它们相当简单。

segments.en: They're pink or white or black.
segments.cn: 它们是粉色、白色或黑色的。

segments.en: And they're almost like a slipper.
segments.cn: 并且几乎像拖鞋。

segments.en: Okay, so they don't have the strap on top.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以它们没有顶部的带子。

segments.en: No, they're stretchy and you just slide them onto your foot.
segments.cn: 不，它们是有弹性的，你只需将它们滑到脚上。

segments.en: It's named after dancers, ballerinas.
segments.cn: 这个名字是以舞者，芭蕾舞者命名的。

segments.en: You know, the dancers who wear pink and they put their hair up and they spin around.
segments.cn: 你知道，穿粉色衣服的舞者，她们把头发盘起来，旋转。

segments.en: And they're not hard on the bottom.
segments.cn: 而且它们底部不硬。

segments.en: They're usually quite soft and they're always flat.
segments.cn: 通常相当柔软，并且总是平的。

segments.en: So maybe these ballerina shoes, they're not the specific types of shoes for dancing if you're a ballerina.
segments.cn: 所以也许这些芭蕾舞鞋并不是专门为芭蕾舞者跳舞的鞋。

segments.en: But maybe they're more adequate for maybe walking around the house or something.
segments.cn: 但也许更适合在家里走动或其他事情。

segments.en: You don't really go out hiking with ballerina shoes.
segments.cn: 你不会穿芭蕾舞鞋去远足。

segments.en: No, you don't go out hiking.
segments.cn: 不，你不会去远足。

segments.en: But they're very popular to wear now to school or work.
segments.cn: 但现在它们在学校或工作中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And the other type of shoes that we had, actually this was really confusing to me.
segments.cn: 还有我们提到的另一种鞋，实际上这让我感到困惑。

segments.en: Slingbacks.
segments.cn: 吊带鞋。

segments.en: Slingback shoes.
segments.cn: 吊带鞋。

segments.en: Well, slingbacks can be hard because they can be heels.
segments.cn: 嗯，吊带鞋可能很难，因为它们可以是高跟鞋。

segments.en: They can be pumps.
segments.cn: 它们可以是泵鞋。

segments.en: But it basically refers to a part of the shoe.
segments.cn: 但它基本上指的是鞋的一部分。

segments.en: So normal shoes, they cover the back of your foot.
segments.cn: 所以普通鞋子覆盖你的脚后跟。

segments.en: But slingbacks have one strap in the back.
segments.cn: 但吊带鞋在后面有一条带子。

segments.en: So maybe if I look at my foot in a slingback, I can see part of my heel.
segments.cn: 所以也许如果我看我的脚在吊带鞋里，我可以看到我的脚后跟的一部分。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So slingbacks have a little strap on the back of your heel since the shoe doesn't close in the back.
segments.cn: 所以吊带鞋在你的脚后跟后面有一条小带子，因为鞋子后面没有封闭。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: But you also have high heels and women's shoes that don't close in the back.
segments.cn: 但你也有高跟鞋和不封闭后面的女鞋。

segments.en: But that you don't have a strap in the back either, right?
segments.cn: 但你后面也没有带子，对吧？

segments.en: Those are open shoes.
segments.cn: 那些是开放鞋。

segments.en: So yeah, they're open in the back.
segments.cn: 所以是的，它们后面是开放的。

segments.en: But a slingback, there's one strap that keeps your shoe on.
segments.cn: 但吊带鞋有一条带子保持鞋子在脚上。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: A lot of different types of shoes we've just taken a look at.
segments.cn: 我们刚刚看过很多不同类型的鞋。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue again, and we'll be back shortly with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一次对话，然后我们很快会回来进行流利度训练。

segments.en: Hi, excuse me, sir.
segments.cn: 嗨，打扰一下，先生。

segments.en: I'm looking for a dress shoe.
segments.cn: 我在找一双正装鞋。

segments.en: My usual pair that I've had for years have finally been stretched out of shape.
segments.cn: 我多年来穿的那双鞋终于变形了。

segments.en: They don't provide any support anymore.
segments.cn: 它们再也没有提供任何支撑。

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: What kind of shoe are you looking for?
segments.cn: 你在找什么类型的鞋？

segments.en: We've got strappy sandals, sleek high heels, edgy pumps.
segments.cn: 我们有带子凉鞋、时尚高跟鞋、前卫泵鞋。

segments.en: If you're looking for something a little more practical, we've got Mary Janes, ballerinas...
segments.cn: 如果你在找更实用的东西，我们有玛丽珍鞋、芭蕾舞鞋...

segments.en: Show me some classic high heels, please.
segments.cn: 请给我看看一些经典的高跟鞋。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Right this way.
segments.cn: 这边请。

segments.en: What color did you have in mind?
segments.cn: 你想要什么颜色？

segments.en: Black.
segments.cn: 黑色。

segments.en: Classic.
segments.cn: 经典。

segments.en: Of course.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: We've got this style here that is very popular.
segments.cn: 我们这里有一种非常受欢迎的款式。

segments.en: Because it's an open-toe shoe, you can wear it any time of the year.
segments.cn: 因为它是开放式鞋头，所以一年四季都可以穿。

segments.en: They look great on everyone.
segments.cn: 每个人穿起来都很好看。

segments.en: Um... too shiny.
segments.cn: 嗯... 太闪亮了。

segments.en: And I wear pantyhose with my shoes, so let's look for a closed-toe shoe.
segments.cn: 我穿连裤袜，所以我们找一双封闭式鞋子吧。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: These are a very nice pair of leather shoes with a two-inch heel, so they are very comfortable.
segments.cn: 这是一双非常不错的皮鞋，带有两英寸的跟，非常舒适。

segments.en: I don't like the pointed toes.
segments.cn: 我不喜欢尖头鞋。

segments.en: Let me take a look at what else you have.
segments.cn: 让我看看你们还有什么。

segments.en: Too high.
segments.cn: 太高了。

segments.en: That one looks like the back would cut into my heel.
segments.cn: 那双看起来后面会磨到我的脚跟。

segments.en: I have a high instep, so I doubt that one would fit properly.
segments.cn: 我有高脚背，所以我怀疑那双合不合适。

segments.en: I don't want bows.
segments.cn: 我不想要蝴蝶结。

segments.en: I find slingbacks very uncomfortable.
segments.cn: 我觉得后跟鞋非常不舒服。

segments.en: Those might as well be stilettos.
segments.cn: 那些简直就像细高跟鞋。

segments.en: Too modern.
segments.cn: 太现代了。

segments.en: Ah, finally!
segments.cn: 啊，终于！

segments.en: This is what I'm looking for.
segments.cn: 这就是我在找的。

segments.en: What size?
segments.cn: 什么尺码？

segments.en: Seven and a half.
segments.cn: 七号半。

segments.en: Here we are.
segments.cn: 在这里。

segments.en: How does it fit?
segments.cn: 合适吗？

segments.en: Not good.
segments.cn: 不太好。

segments.en: They're too tight.
segments.cn: 太紧了。

segments.en: The length is right, but the shoe is too narrow and it's pinching my toes.
segments.cn: 长度合适，但鞋子太窄，夹到我的脚趾。

segments.en: And there'd be no room for my insoles.
segments.cn: 而且没有空间放我的鞋垫。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I have the Patience for this today.
segments.cn: 我今天没有耐心。

segments.en: They just don't make shoes like they used to.
segments.cn: 他们的鞋子再也没有以前那么好了。

segments.en: I'll come back another time.
segments.cn: 我改天再来。

segments.en: Have a nice day, ma'am.
segments.cn: 祝您有美好的一天，女士。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at five key things on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器上的五个关键点。

segments.en: Okay, well the reason we're shopping today is because the woman needs a new pair of shoes because her old shoes can't be worn anymore.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们购物的原因是因为这位女士需要一双新鞋，因为她的旧鞋子不能再穿了。

segments.en: What's wrong with them, Marco?
segments.cn: 它们有什么问题，马尔科？

segments.en: She said that they were stretched out of shape.
segments.cn: 她说它们已经变形了。

segments.en: Okay, so to stretch or to be stretched out, this means that maybe they've been pulled and worn and they're stretched so much that they don't have the original shape anymore.
segments.cn: 好的，所以变形意味着它们可能被拉扯和磨损，已经失去了原来的形状。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So just imagine you have a new t-shirt and all of a sudden somebody takes you from your t-shirt and pulls you really hard.
segments.cn: 想象一下你有一件新T恤，突然有人用力拉扯你。

segments.en: And usually what happens is this t-shirt is going to be stretched out of shape.
segments.cn: 通常情况下，这件T恤会变形。

segments.en: You pulled it so hard that it loses its original form.
segments.cn: 你拉得太紧，以至于它失去了原来的形状。

segments.en: So now maybe the neck is very low or the t-shirt is too long on one side.
segments.cn: 现在可能领口很低，或者T恤一侧太长。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So that's what happens when you stretch something out of shape.
segments.cn: 这就是当你拉扯某物变形时发生的事情。

segments.en: Great.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So her old shoes are stretched out of shape and they don't provide support anymore.
segments.cn: 所以她的旧鞋子变形了，已经不再提供支持。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So to provide support.
segments.cn: 所以提供支持。

segments.en: Now what kind of support is she referring to?
segments.cn: 她指的是什么样的支持？

segments.en: She's talking about foot support.
segments.cn: 她在说脚部支持。

segments.en: So for example, slippers are a kind of shoe basically that don't provide support.
segments.cn: 例如，拖鞋基本上是一种不提供支持的鞋子。

segments.en: They're very soft.
segments.cn: 它们非常柔软。

segments.en: But can you walk around all day in slippers?
segments.cn: 但你能整天穿拖鞋吗？

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 不能。

segments.en: That doesn't help your foot.
segments.cn: 这对你的脚没有帮助。

segments.en: But if you're trying to find shoes that are really good for walking, you need to find ones that provide support.
segments.cn: 但如果你想找适合走路的鞋子，你需要找那些提供支持的鞋子。

segments.en: That means that always support your foot, the bottom of your foot.
segments.cn: 这意味着始终支持你的脚，脚底。

segments.en: Otherwise your foot gets too tired.
segments.cn: 否则你的脚会太累。

segments.en: Not only the bottom, but it could be also your ankle.
segments.cn: 不仅是脚底，也可能是你的脚踝。

segments.en: For example, you can't really go hiking with shoes like these with sandals because obviously you're walking around rocks and it doesn't provide support on your ankle.
segments.cn: 例如，你不能穿这样的凉鞋去远足，因为显然你在走石头，鞋子对脚踝没有支持。

segments.en: Maybe you can hurt your ankle if you don't have it.
segments.cn: 如果没有支持，你可能会伤到脚踝。

segments.en: So maybe a hiking boot will provide more support.
segments.cn: 所以也许登山靴会提供更多支持。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And then the woman also mentioned that it's hard for her to find a shoe because she said, I have a high instep.
segments.cn: 然后这位女士还提到她很难找到鞋子，因为她说，我有高脚背。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So think about the foot.
segments.cn: 所以想想脚。

segments.en: You've got toes in the very front and a heel in the very back.
segments.cn: 你在前面有脚趾，后面有脚跟。

segments.en: But in the middle, on top, you have the instep.
segments.cn: 但在中间，上面是脚背。

segments.en: So this is basically the top of your foot.
segments.cn: 所以这基本上是你脚的顶部。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So if she has a high instep, it means that her foot is kind of thick.
segments.cn: 如果她有高脚背，意味着她的脚有点厚。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Some people have thin feet.
segments.cn: 有些人脚很瘦。

segments.en: She has kind of a thick foot.
segments.cn: 她的脚有点厚。

segments.en: So fitting her foot into a shoe is sometimes hard.
segments.cn: 所以把她的脚放进鞋子有时很困难。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: We're not talking about the width of the foot.
segments.cn: 我们不是在谈论脚的宽度。

segments.en: We're talking about the height or how tall it is.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论高度或它有多高。

segments.en: From the bottom to the top of the foot.
segments.cn: 从脚底到脚顶。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So that's what she means by high instep.
segments.cn: 所以这就是她所说的高脚背。

segments.en: And well, they also mentioned different types of shoes.
segments.cn: 他们还提到不同类型的鞋子。

segments.en: She said she didn't want an open toe shoe.
segments.cn: 她说她不想要开放式鞋头。

segments.en: She wanted a closed toe shoe.
segments.cn: 她想要封闭式鞋头。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So this is a really important classification for women's shoes, especially.
segments.cn: 所以这是女性鞋子非常重要的分类，尤其是。

segments.en: Open toe means that the toe of the shoe, the very, very front, has a hole or an opening.
segments.cn: 开放式鞋头意味着鞋子的前面有一个孔或开口。

segments.en: So you can see the toes.
segments.cn: 所以你可以看到脚趾。

segments.en: Closed toe is the opposite.
segments.cn: 封闭式鞋头正好相反。

segments.en: So personally, in the wintertime, I always wear closed-toed shoes because I think open-toed shoes are too cold.
segments.cn: 所以就我个人而言，在冬天，我总是穿封闭式鞋子，因为我觉得开放式鞋子太冷。

segments.en: Too cold.
segments.cn: 太冷了。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that's basically it.
segments.cn: 所以基本上就是这样。

segments.en: I guess men, we don't really have this type of shoe between open toe and closed toe.
segments.cn: 我想男性之间没有这种开放式和封闭式鞋子的区别。

segments.en: No, maybe.
segments.cn: 不，也许吧。

segments.en: No, you don't really.
segments.cn: 不，你确实没有。

segments.en: But heels, maybe you could have an open toe shoe or closed-toed shoe.
segments.cn: 但高跟鞋，或许你可以有开放式鞋头或封闭式鞋头。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，对。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So a lot of interesting things.
segments.cn: 所以有很多有趣的事情。

segments.en: This is useful for women out there and also for boyfriends.
segments.cn: 这对外面的女性和男朋友都很有用。

segments.en: Maybe now you know what type of shoe your girlfriend may want.
segments.cn: 也许现在你知道你女朋友可能想要什么类型的鞋子。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Alright, so let's listen to this dialogue for the last time and we'll be back shortly.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们最后一次听这个对话，我们很快会回来。

segments.en: Hi, excuse me, sir.
segments.cn: 嗨，打扰一下，先生。

segments.en: I'm looking for a dress shoe.
segments.cn: 我在找一双正装鞋。

segments.en: My usual pair that I've had for years have finally been stretched out of shape.
segments.cn: 我多年来一直穿的那双鞋终于变形了。

segments.en: They don't provide any support anymore.
segments.cn: 现在它们不再提供任何支撑。

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: What kind of shoe are you looking for?
segments.cn: 你在找什么样的鞋子？

segments.en: We've got strappy sandals, sleek high heels, edgy pumps.
segments.cn: 我们有带带子的凉鞋、时尚高跟鞋、前卫的泵鞋。

segments.en: If you're looking for something a little more practical, we've got Mary Janes, ballerinas.
segments.cn: 如果你在找更实用的东西，我们有玛丽珍鞋、芭蕾舞鞋。

segments.en: Show me some classic high heels, please.
segments.cn: 请给我看看一些经典的高跟鞋。

segments.en: Okay, right this way.
segments.cn: 好的，这边请。

segments.en: What color did you have in mind?
segments.cn: 你想要什么颜色？

segments.en: Black.
segments.cn: 黑色。

segments.en: Classic.
segments.cn: 经典。

segments.en: Of course.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: We've got this style here that is very popular.
segments.cn: 我们这里有一种非常受欢迎的款式。

segments.en: Because it's an open-toed shoe, you can wear it any time of the year.
segments.cn: 因为它是开放式鞋头，所以你可以在任何季节穿。

segments.en: They look great on everyone.
segments.cn: 每个人穿起来都很好看。

segments.en: Um, too shiny.
segments.cn: 嗯，太闪亮了。

segments.en: And I wear pantyhose with my shoes, so let's look for a closed-toed shoe.
segments.cn: 而且我穿丝袜，所以我们找一双封闭式鞋子吧。

segments.en: Okay, these are a very nice pair of leather shoes with a two-inch heel, so they are very comfortable.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一双非常不错的皮鞋，带有两英寸的跟，所以非常舒适。

segments.en: I don't like the pointed toes.
segments.cn: 我不喜欢尖头鞋。

segments.en: Let me take a look at what else you have.
segments.cn: 让我看看你还有什么。

segments.en: Too high.
segments.cn: 太高了。

segments.en: That one looks like the back would cut into my heel.
segments.cn: 那双看起来后面会磨到我的脚跟。

segments.en: I have a high instep, so I doubt that one would fit properly.
segments.cn: 我有高脚背，所以我怀疑那双合不合适。

segments.en: I don't want bows.
segments.cn: 我不想要蝴蝶结。

segments.en: I find slingbacks very uncomfortable.
segments.cn: 我觉得后跟鞋非常不舒服。

segments.en: Those might as well be stilettos.
segments.cn: 那些简直可以算是细高跟鞋。

segments.en: Too modern.
segments.cn: 太现代了。

segments.en: Ah, finally!
segments.cn: 啊，终于！

segments.en: This is what I'm looking for.
segments.cn: 这就是我在找的。

segments.en: What size?
segments.cn: 多大尺码？

segments.en: Seven and a half.
segments.cn: 七号半。

segments.en: Here we are!
segments.cn: 在这里！

segments.en: How does it fit?
segments.cn: 穿起来怎么样？

segments.en: Not good.
segments.cn: 不好。

segments.en: They're too tight.
segments.cn: 太紧了。

segments.en: The length is right, but the shoe is too narrow and it's pinching my toes.
segments.cn: 长度合适，但鞋子太窄，夹到我的脚趾。

segments.en: And there'd be no room for my insoles.
segments.cn: 而且没有空间放我的鞋垫。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't think I have the Patience for this today.
segments.cn: 我今天没有耐心。

segments.en: They just don't make shoes like they used to.
segments.cn: 他们就是不再像以前那样做鞋子了。

segments.en: I'll come back another time.
segments.cn: 我会另找时间再来。

segments.en: Have a nice day, ma'am.
segments.cn: 祝您有美好的一天，女士。

segments.en: Alright, so talking about shoes, there's so many types.
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到鞋子，有很多种类。

segments.en: And I think women are notoriously famous for having a lot of shoes.
segments.cn: 我认为女性以拥有很多鞋子而闻名。

segments.en: Why is this?
segments.cn: 为什么会这样？

segments.en: Some women are.
segments.cn: 有些女性是。

segments.en: Some women aren't.
segments.cn: 有些女性不是。

segments.en: It depends on the person.
segments.cn: 这取决于个人。

segments.en: But part of the problem, as you said earlier, is that there's so many different kinds of women's shoes that now we expect women to have a different pair of shoes for every different occasion.
segments.cn: 但正如你之前所说，问题的一部分是有这么多不同种类的女性鞋子，现在我们期望女性为每个不同的场合都有一双不同的鞋子。

segments.en: Work shoes, hiking shoes, running shoes, wedding shoes.
segments.cn: 工作鞋、登山鞋、跑鞋、婚鞋。

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: Summer shoes, winter shoes, fall shoes.
segments.cn: 夏季鞋、冬季鞋、秋季鞋。

segments.en: So you need so many different kinds of shoes, you end up buying many different kinds.
segments.cn: 所以你需要这么多不同种类的鞋子，最终你会买很多不同的鞋子。

segments.en: I think that that's true.
segments.cn: 我认为这是真的。

segments.en: And also, basically, women like to look nice.
segments.cn: 而且，基本上，女性喜欢看起来好看。

segments.en: So that's why, you know, you do your makeup, you have earrings, and they have nice bags.
segments.cn: 所以这就是为什么你化妆、戴耳环，还有漂亮的包包。

segments.en: So I guess it's also part of it is that you pay more attention to what type of shoe you're wearing that maybe goes well with the outfit.
segments.cn: 所以我想这也是因为你更关注穿什么类型的鞋子，可能与服装搭配。

segments.en: I think maybe guys, not all guys, obviously, as well as not all women, but guys are a little bit more generic.
segments.cn: 我觉得也许男生，当然不是所有男生，也不是所有女生，但男生可能更通用一些。

segments.en: Because, like, jeans pretty much go well with any type of shoe as long as it's maybe black or brown, right?
segments.cn: 因为像牛仔裤几乎可以与任何类型的鞋子搭配，只要是黑色或棕色的，对吧？

segments.en: Or something like this.
segments.cn: 或者类似的东西。

segments.en: True.
segments.cn: 真的。

segments.en: Although I know a lot of guys who have many different kinds of shoes.
segments.cn: 虽然我知道很多男生有很多不同种类的鞋子。

segments.en: True, true.
segments.cn: 真的，真的。

segments.en: It takes up a lot of space in the closet as well.
segments.cn: 这也占据了很多衣橱空间。

segments.en: It does.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: Shoes are hard to carry around.
segments.cn: 鞋子很难携带。

segments.en: And actually, I find it kind of hard to get rid of my shoes.
segments.cn: 而且实际上，我发现很难处理我的鞋子。

segments.en: I think they have to be ripped or just completely unwearable in order for me to throw a shoe away.
segments.cn: 我觉得它们必须破损或完全无法穿才能让我扔掉一双鞋。

segments.en: Because otherwise, you know, you can still wear it sometimes on the weekends.
segments.cn: 因为否则，你知道，有时你仍然可以在周末穿。

segments.en: That's true.
segments.cn: 这是真的。

segments.en: Although I tend to wear my shoes down.
segments.cn: 虽然我倾向于把鞋子穿坏。

segments.en: That means I wear them until they die.
segments.cn: 这意味着我穿到它们坏掉。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Actually, I've had shoes that I've worn the soles down.
segments.cn: 实际上，我有过鞋子穿坏了鞋底。

segments.en: And then I just get the sole changed because I like the shoe so much.
segments.cn: 然后我只是换了鞋底，因为我太喜欢那双鞋了。

segments.en: Well, let us know.
segments.cn: 好吧，告诉我们。

segments.en: Do you guys like to buy shoes?
segments.cn: 你们喜欢买鞋子吗？

segments.en: Do you have a lot of shoes?
segments.cn: 你们有很多鞋子吗？

segments.en: Maybe you don't have that many shoes.
segments.cn: 也许你们没有那么多鞋子。

segments.en: We're curious to know about this in other cultures as well.
segments.cn: 我们也想知道其他文化的情况。

segments.en: Because I know in the United States, shoe shopping is very, very popular.
segments.cn: 因为我知道在美国，买鞋子非常非常受欢迎。

segments.en: In Holland, they have traditional wooden shoes.
segments.cn: 在荷兰，他们有传统的木鞋。

segments.en: Yeah, they do.
segments.cn: 是的，他们有。

segments.en: Those are called clogs.
segments.cn: 那些叫木屐。

segments.en: Clogs.
segments.cn: 木屐。

segments.en: So let us know maybe what type of shoes are also very unique to your country or culture.
segments.cn: 所以请告诉我们，也许你们国家或文化中有哪些独特的鞋子。

segments.en: We're at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们在EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Thank you for watching.
segments.cn: 感谢观看。
